concise_definition: v. 填满, 充满, 充当, 任职

definitions.explanation_en: To put or add something into a container or space until it is full or completely occupied.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将某物放入容器或空间中，直至其被填满或完全占据。
definitions.example_en: She fills the glass with water before serving it.
definitions.example_cn: 她在上菜前把玻璃杯倒满水。

definitions.explanation_en: To occupy or serve in a role, position, or function, especially temporarily or in place of someone else.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指临时或替代他人担任某个角色、职位或职能。
definitions.example_en: He fills the position of manager while the regular manager is on leave.
definitions.example_cn: 在常任经理休假期间，他暂代经理一职。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause something to be filled with a particular quality, emotion, or substance, often abstract.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指使某物充满某种抽象的品质、情感或物质。
definitions.example_en: The room fills with laughter as the children play.
definitions.example_cn: 孩子们玩耍时，房间里充满了笑声。

comparison.analysis: “Satisfies” (满足) 强调满足需求、欲望或期望，侧重于心理或功能上的完满感，而非物理上的填充。例如：This meal satisfies my hunger. 而 “fills” 更强调物理或空间上的充实，如填满容器或职位。
“Occupies” (占据) 侧重于占据空间、时间或位置，但不一定意味着“充满”或“填满”。例如：The book occupies the top shelf. 它只是在那儿，不一定是填满整个架子。而 “fills” 暗示了空间被完全或充分地布满。
“Completes” (完成) 指使某事物达到完整或终结状态，强调过程的结束，而非填充动作本身。例如：He completed the project. 而 “fills” 强调的是将空缺或空白填入内容，不必然意味着整体任务的完成。
